item.description:
Did you know that the infamous, the cantankerous, the grandiloquent, the absurd, and the darkly funny,  Roald Dahl wrote for grownups, too? While his fame may have come almost exclusively from his children's stories, he quietly and perpetually turned in short fiction at various literary magazines. "The Best of Roald Dahl" is a collection of this fiction, spanning the length of his writing career and rectifying him as a great author.

From "Over to You" and "Switch Bitch" to "The Wonderful Story of Henry Sugar," these are no ordinary short stories. Although they seem to have no traceable commonality, his stories share a unique aesthetic -- they often have what one might call an ethereal quality.

"An ingenious imagination, a fascination with odd and ordinary detail, and a lust for its thorough exploitation are the...strengths of Dahl's storytelling."--New York Times Book Review


Please read and come prepared to discuss:

Over to You

Someone Like You

Switch Bitch

The Wonderful Story of Henry Sugar

Kiss Kiss

group.name: Classic Books: Book Club for Die-hard Readers

item.name: Dahl: The Best of Roald Dahl
